 </pub-date>       <self-uri xlink:href="http://zenodo.org/record/10572"/>       <self-uri xlink:href="http://www.coolstars18.net/"/>       <self-uri xlink:href="https://zenodo.org/record/10572/files/CS18_Poster.png?subformat=icon-90"/>       <self-uri xlink:href="https://zenodo.org/record/10572/files/CS18_Poster.key.zip"/>       <self-uri xlink:href="https://zenodo.org/record/10572/files/CS18_Poster.pdf"/>     </article-meta>     <abstract><p>We performed an all-sky cross-match of the 2MASS and WISE catalogs to search for new very late-type (&gt; M5) candidate members to young, moving groups using the BANYAN statistical tool to create the BASS catalog. We present follow-up results of this catalog, unveiling many new young BDs and new directly imaged exoplanets. These late-type and young objects will be very compelling targets for the search of exoplanets by direct imaging, due to their youth and proximity. Their moving group membership also provides useful constraints on their age.</p></abstract>   </front>   <article-type>user-cool-stars</article-type> </article>   </articles>
